intro: Quercus litseoides, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a species of flowering plant in the beech family, Fagaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are typically enclosed in a cupule. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Quercus litseoides plays an important ecological role, providing food and habitat for various wildlife species.
